info.name: Transmorpher Server API v1
info.description:
This file describes the Transmorpher Server API.

- It includes examples for failed calls as well, until they are all covered in tests.
- Filter for ": OK" to only see correct API calls.
    

Configuration:

- create a user on Transmorpher: `php artisan create:user postman postman@example.com http://amigor/transmorpher/notifications`
- use the provided auth token and adjust the "authToken" variable
- if you're using a domain different from "transmorpher.test", you will have to adjust the "domain" variable
    

If you want to use the collection with the already defined files, you will have to go to `Settings > General > Allow reading files outside working directory`, and enable the option.

item.name: Image

exec: pm.test("Unable to obtain image upload token: no auth", function () {
pm.test("Unable to obtain image upload slot: Invalid identifier", function () {

request.description: Providing the auth token, the client reserves an upload slot for an image identifier. This action of the client backend secures the transaction, allowing the frontend to upload the image to the Transmorpher media server directly.

exec: pm.test("Unable to upload image: no auth", function () {
pm.test("Image upload rejected: File field is required", function () {
pm.test("Image upload rejected: File has wrong mime type", function () {
"message": "The file must be a file of type: jpg, png, gif, webp.",
"The file must be a file of type: jpg, png, gif, webp."
pm.test("Image upload rejected: Upload slot expired", function () {
pm.test("Image upload rejected: File has wrong mime type", function () {
"message": "The provided identifier does not match the identifier of the reserved upload slot.",
"The provided identifier does not match the identifier of the reserved upload slot."
pm.test("Image upload rejected: File has wrong mime type", function () {
pm.test("Image upload rejected: File has wrong mime type", function () {
"message": "The identifier format is invalid. (and 1 more error)",
"The provided identifier does not match the identifier of the reserved upload slot."

request.description: Providing the correct upload slot token for the image identifier, the client frontend can upload the image to the Transmorpher media server. The answer of this call contains the public URL where the image will be available immediatly after upload.

item.description: The Transmorpher Media server treats images in realtime. As soon as an image is uploaded, it is available for download. Image transformations are created when they are requested.

item.name: Video

request.description: Providing the auth token, the client reserves an upload slot for a video identifier. This action of the client backend secures the transaction, allowing the frontend to upload the video to the Transmorpher media server directly.

exec: pm.test("Video upload rejected: File has wrong mime type", function () {
"message": "The file must be a file of type: video/x-msvideo, video/mpeg, video/ogg, video/webm, video/mp4.",
"The file must be a file of type: video/x-msvideo, video/mpeg, video/ogg, video/webm, video/mp4."
"message": "Successfully uploaded new video version, transcoding job has been dispatched.",

request.description: Providing the correct upload slot token for the video identifier, the client frontend can upload the video to the Transmorpher media server. When the video has been transcoded, the client backend will receive a notification message, which includes the public URL of the video.

exec: "message": "Successfully set video version, transcoding job has been dispatched.",
pm.test("Video not found after deletion", function () {

item.description: The Transmorpher Media server processes videos in a queue. When the encoding into regular and stream formats is completed, the client is notified through a signed call. The client has to use the public key URL to verify the server's signature.

item.name: Video Chunks

request.description: The file content must not be transmitted as a text form field.

This is the simplest way to define the chunks. In this case, the chunks start counting at 1. The answer contains the percentage uploaded value, which can be used in percentage bars etc. Make sure to transmit the same file name for all chunks!

exec: "message": "Successfully uploaded new video version, transcoding job has been dispatched.",

request.description: Number 2 is the last chunk in this example. When it has been uploaded, the regular video upload complete message is returned.
Dropzone is also supported, including parallel uploads. Mind that the chunks start counting at 0 in this case. Make sure to transmit the same file name for all chunks!

exec: "message": "Successfully uploaded new video version, transcoding job has been dispatched.",

request.description: Number 1 is the last chunk in this example. When it has been uploaded, the regular video upload complete message is returned.

item.description: Video files can be sent as multipart form attachments. The file content must be transmitted as file, not as a text form field. Make sure to transmit the same file name for all chunks!

request.description: Messages from the Transmorpher media server to a client are signed. This public key allows verifying the identity of the notification sender.

exec: pm.test("Received the cache invalidation reset counter", function() {

request.description: When the Transmorpher server needs to invalidate its derivatives, it sends a notification to all clients. The clients can also look up the current invalidation count with this call. The value is to be used as part of the cache buster in the URL.
